intro: Fraxinus schiedeana var. palmarum, commonly known as the Mexican ash, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a slender, often twisted trunk. The leaves are simple, alternate, and pinnately compound, with ovate to lanceolate leaflets. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in catkins, followed by winged fruits that aid in wind dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
